channel.title: DDoSers Attacked -.-
channel.description:
Can I report DDoSers for attacking my RSPS like irl Reporting now moparscape reporting.
Cause i'm real sick of this

item.title: DDoSers Attacked -.-
item.dc:creator: @Smyril Smyril
item.description:
@Smyril wrote:

Berky-Scape:

You cannot prevent people from DDoSing your server, only if you shut down your server. Connections coming from DDoSers aren’t related to Ingame player accounts.

But you can in fact prevent the DDoSers to ever reach the server, by IP banning them through a fire wall, that would prevent the server from overflowing, but still not reduce lag, however if the DDoSers got dynamic IP, its almost impossible.

Read full topic

item.title: DDoSers Attacked -.-
item.dc:creator: @mursanari mursanari
item.description:
@mursanari wrote:

I would just like to explain to you that a 2 accounts per ip wont work because a DDoS is multiple ip’s spamming packets to the server directly. Unless you are thinking of a DoS wich is just a singular computer spamming packets.

Read full topic

item.title: DDoSers Attacked -.-
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Just like computers used to be people that did calculations, eh? It’s all down to definition I guess. I just wouldn’t call people that don’t think DDoSing is hacking stupid though, which some people in this thread were

Read full topic

item.title: DDoSers Attacked -.-
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Lol fair enough in that sense. Though some may view that as a form of hacking. Shutting down services, from your computer.

That again depends on how hacking is defined. Hacking used to refer to programming. You can see the differences in how people use it. I don’t think anyone is wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: DDoSers Attacked -.-
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:65, topic:410847”][quote author=Coelho link=topic=512108.msg3743300#msg3743300 date=1315538488]

DDoSing is not hacking…

Oh my fucking god facepalm New signature.
You have officially conquered my other two previous signatures.

Please state how DDoSing remotely relates to hacking.
[/quote]
How do they relate? You are gaining unauthorized access to other computers/servers and using them to attack others… what more to be said.[/quote]Not always. The act of calling a DDoS against someone (while yes completely illegal and wrong), isn’t hacking in its own right. Obviously distributing the malicious stuff is In general I guess you could say DDoS’ing involves hacking (99.99% of the time, but I’m sure you could do it on computers that give you access if you wanted to), but DDoS’ing itself isn’t hacking (again, not saying it’s right or legal)

Read full topic

item.title: DDoSers Attacked -.-
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:54, topic:410847”][quote author=Coelho link=topic=512108.msg3743300#msg3743300 date=1315538488]

DDoSing is not hacking…

Oh my fucking god facepalm New signature.
You have officially conquered my other two previous signatures.

Please state how DDoSing remotely relates to hacking.
[/quote]
Do you even know how DDoSing works? Why does one person seemingly have so many IPs?
After you can solve that simple question, how do you think he gets those IPs? How do you think he gets the viruses on the zombie computers?

Please just google what DDoSing is. You are absolutely incorrect in your theory of what DDoSing actually is.[/quote]
I am quite aware you need zombies to ddos, however, I was stating that the action of ddosing itself is not hacking at all… Reminds me of some noobs who say:

OMG IMA HACKZORS YOU BY DDOSING< YOU WASTCH
Idiots...

Read full topic
